vrx:content.vrx:description: The Wide Field Astronomy Unit at the IfA provides astronomical surveys and infrastructure through a range of activities: * Currently working on the Science Archives for the UKIRT Wide-Field Camera, WFCAM (WSA early data release Feb 2006) and the VISTA Survey Telescope (to be commissioned in 2006). * It has developed, and now operates, TByte-scale on-line sky surveys derived from scanning photographic plates observed with the UK Schmidt telescope in Australia. These include flat-file databases from the broad-band and H-alpha surveys, and a relational database Catalogue, the SuperCosmos Science Archive (SSA), built as the prototype of the WFCAM/VISTA science archive. * It operates the SuperCOSMOS plate measuring machine which is digitising photographic plates observed with the UK and Palomar Schmidt telescopes. * It is part of the AstroGrid consortium, an e-science project working towards integrated astronomical database access and advanced data-mining tools, as part of an international initiative towards the "Virtual Observatory". * It has developed, and now operates, on-line Science Archives for the 6dF galaxy redshift and RAVE stellar radial velocity surveys being observed by the AAO with the UK Schmidt Telescope. * It maintains an archive of original photographic plates observed with the UK Schmidt Telescope and copies of photographic sky atlases produced from the UK, Palomar and ESO Schmidt telescopes.
